items.name: Reticle
items.summary: Generates and controls a reticle based on a set configuration.

items.name: pregenerated
items.summary:
When set to false the reticle will be generated on start, otherwise
it is assumed the reticle images are already created and configured.

items.name: images
items.summary: References of each child reticle image (Read only).

items.name: spreader
items.summary: Applies reticle spread to each image (Read only).

items.name: config
items.summary: The configuration applied to the reticle.

items.name: color
items.summary: The active color of the reticle.

items.name: spread
items.summary:
The amount of spread applied to the reticle. This is often used as
an indication of a weapon's accuracy.

items.name: ReticleBloom
items.summary:
Handles dynamically changing the spread of a reticle based on a given
bloom amount. Bloom is a way of visualizing the accuracy of a weapon.
The more bloom the less accurate a weapon is. Bloom is added and removed
when the behavior is enabled or disabled, repectively.

items.name: reticle
items.summary: The reticle that the bloom effect is applied to.

items.name: spread
items.summary: The amount of spread to apply to the reticle when bloomed.

items.name: maxSpread
items.summary: The maximum amount of spread that can be applied to the reticle.

items.name: decayRate
items.summary: How quickly the reticle bloom decays back to zero.

items.name: bloom
items.summary: The current amount of bloom applied to the reticle (Read only).

items.name: baseSpread
items.summary: The base amount of spread on the reticle without bloom (Read only).

items.name: Apply()
items.summary: Applies the bloom to the reticle.

items.name: ReticleConfiguration.Layout
items.summary:
Determines how the reticle images are displayed which changes how
the reticle is positioned.

items.name: Cardinal
items.summary: Displays the reticle images along the cardinal axes.

items.name: Radial
items.summary:
Displays the reticle images in a radial pattern around the
center point.

items.name: ReticleConfiguration.Shape
items.summary:
Defines the overall shape of the reticle images which changes how
the reticle is sized.

items.name: Rectangular
items.summary:
Defines the reticle images as rectangular with a set width and
height.

items.name: Circular
items.summary: Defines the reticle images as circular with a set radius.

items.name: ReticleConfiguration.Spread
items.summary: Determines the behavior of the reticle spread.

items.name: None
items.summary: Indicates the reticle does not spread.

items.name: Static
items.summary: Indicates the reticle has spread but the amount does not change.

items.name: Dynamic
items.summary:
Indicates the reticle has spread and the amount can change
dynamically.

items.name: ReticleConfiguration
items.summary:
Defines all reticle configuration properties that can be saved as a
predefined asset.

items.name: sprite
items.summary: The sprite rendered for each reticle image.

items.name: shape
items.summary: The shape of the reticle images.

items.name: spread
items.summary: The behavior of the reticle spread.

items.name: color
items.summary: The color of the reticle images.

items.name: elements
items.summary: The amount of images that make up the reticle.

items.name: layout
items.summary: Determines how the reticle images are displayed.

items.name: center
items.summary: The center point of the reticle.

items.name: size
items.summary: The overall size of the reticle.

items.name: thickness
items.summary:
The thickness of reticle crosshairs (only applicable to rectangular
shaped reticle images).

items.name: offset
items.summary:
The offset of the reticle images from the center point. The offset
is used as the amount of spread for static reticles.

items.name: rotation
items.summary: The local rotation of the reticle.

items.name: outline
items.summary: Draws an outline around the reticle images.

items.name: outlineColor
items.summary: The color of the reticle outline.

items.name: outlineDistance
items.summary: The distance of the reticle outline effect from the base sprite.

items.name: mask
items.summary: Applies a mask fill to the reticle.

items.name: maskFillAmount
items.summary: The percentage of fill applied to the reticle mask.

items.name: ReticleGroup
items.summary: Groups together multiple reticles into one.

items.name: reticles
items.summary: The reticles contained in the group (Read only).

items.name: ReticleTarget
items.summary: Indicates an entity that can be targeted by a reticle.

items.name: reticleColor
items.summary: The color of the reticle when the target is looked at.

items.name: ReticleTargeting.Colors
items.summary: A set of colors that commonly represent targets.

items.name: neutral
items.summary: A common color for neutral targets, usually white.

items.name: friendly
items.summary: A common color for friendly targets, usually green.

items.name: hostile
items.summary: A common color for hostile targets, usually red.

items.name: cautious
items.summary: A common color for cautious targets, usually yellow.

items.name: ReticleTargeting
items.summary:
Handles changing the appearance of the reticle when targeting other
objects. For example, the reticle might become red when targeting an
enemy or green when targeting a friendly character.

items.name: reticle
items.summary: The reticle that changes color (Read only).

items.name: lookTransform
items.summary: The transform from which raycasts originate, usually the camera.

items.name: scanRate
items.summary: The amount of seconds between raycasts.

items.name: nextScanTime
items.summary: The time at which the next scan will occur (Read only).

items.name: maxDistance
items.summary: The max distance the ray can check for targets.

items.name: layerMask
items.summary: The layers that can be targeted by the reticle.

items.name: Scan()
items.summary:
Performs a scan to see if the reticle should change appearance based
on the target object being looked at.

items.name: ChangeAppearance(ReticleTarget)
items.summary: Changes the appearance of the reticle to reflect the target.

parameters.description: The target to set the reticle apperance for.

items.name: ResetAppearance()
items.summary: Resets the appearance of the reticle to the default reticle config.
